Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry
A pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry.
A pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry.

A pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'Thought Provoking' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'edited and compiled by Caliste'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of shooting stars.
pallid sanguine suede tome cover

A pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'Thought Provoking' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'edited and compiled by Caliste'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of shooting stars.

A pallid sanguine suede tome of poetry. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'Thought Provoking' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'edited and compiled by Caliste'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of shooting stars.
Pages of Delight

Besmirched with grime and marked with time,
A leather volume sits,
Faded vellum pages, cloaked with dust of the ages
Fly forth with musty grit
So ancient is this dusty tome!
This venerated poems home!
That one can scarcely dare to surmise, That within its pages, value lies;
Lays and lore from days of yore
Tell of legends that have been;
Riddles and rhymes, good deeds and crimes,
All reveal their tales within.
And softly, subtly, these stories teeming
Will quickly cast a net of dreaming;
A weave of dragon's breath and gryphon plumes,
Of mermaidtails in silver spume.
And flying thus, with wings of dust,
Blithe as a moonlit faerie;
One encounters the delight, the beauty bright,
Found in a humble library.

Will quickly cast a net of dreaming;
A weave of dragon's breath and gryphon plumes,
Of mermaidtails in silver spume.
And flying thus, with wings of dust,
Blithe as a moonlit faerie;
One encounters the delight, the beauty bright,
Found in a humble library.
One Day

"One Day:
One day, your arms will possess me,
One day, you will ask for my hand,
One day, the ring will be shining,
In the sun as we walk thro' the sand.
One day, romance will caress me,
One day, the church bells will chime,
And we will start walking together forever,
For the love of my dreams will be mine."

"One Day:
One day, your arms will possess me,
One day, you will ask for my hand,
One day, the ring will be shining,
In the sun as we walk thro' the sand.
One day, romance will caress me,
One day, the church bells will chime,
And we will start walking together forever,
For the love of my dreams will be mine."
Forbidden Angel

"Forbidden Angel
An angel tantalizes me with heaven's fire,
To covet a life just beyond my grasp.
Years paint the path of forbidden desire,
As his wings burn my skin.
Woe to you, forbidden Angel,
Oh blissful agony drown my cries,
Expose my souls ravenous despair,
Gratify me with your wings afire."

"Forbidden Angel
An angel tantalizes me with heaven's fire,
To covet a life just beyond my grasp.
Years paint the path of forbidden desire,
As his wings burn my skin.
Woe to you, forbidden Angel,
Oh blissful agony drown my cries,
Expose my souls ravenous despair,
Gratify me with your wings afire."
Believe

"Believe:
Believe in your heart that
something wonderful is about to happen.
Love your life.
Believe in your own powers,
and your own potential,
and in your own innate goodness.
Wake every morning
with the awe of just being alive.
Discover each day the magnificent,
awesome beauty in the world.
Explore and embrace life in yourself
and in everyone.
Reach within to find your own specialness.
Amaze yourself and rouse those around you
to the potential of tomorrow, the future.
Don't be afraid to admit
that you are less than perfect;
this is the essence of your humanity.
Let those who love you help you.
Trust enough to be able to take.
Look with hope to the horizon;
for today is all we truly have."
Live it well.

"Believe:
Believe in your heart that
something wonderful is about to happen.
Love your life.
Believe in your own powers,
and your own potential,
and in your own innate goodness.
Wake every morning
with the awe of just being alive.
Discover each day the magnificent,
awesome beauty in the world.
Explore and embrace life in yourself
and in everyone.
Reach within to find your own specialness.
Amaze yourself and rouse those around you
to the potential of tomorrow, the future.
Don't be afraid to admit
that you are less than perfect;
this is the essence of your humanity.
Let those who love you help you.
Trust enough to be able to take.
Look with hope to the horizon;
for today is all we truly have."
Live it well.
Regret

"Regret:
Her loveliness fills his waking hours,
And her tender arms haunt his troubled dreams.
Her voice is a fountain of the sweetest waters,
And her breath, the kiss of angels.
The tone of her skin, the scent of her hair,
The color of her lips in a brightly lit room,
And the softness of her careless touch,
All are memories etched into his soul.
His longing heart races at the sound of her name,
And his emptiness is complete without her.
He counts the minutes until their hearts are one,
And each minute lost is his eternal regret."

"Regret:
Her loveliness fills his waking hours,
And her tender arms haunt his troubled dreams.
Her voice is a fountain of the sweetest waters,
And her breath, the kiss of angels.
The tone of her skin, the scent of her hair,
The color of her lips in a brightly lit room,
And the softness of her careless touch,
All are memories etched into his soul.
His longing heart races at the sound of her name,
And his emptiness is complete without her.
He counts the minutes until their hearts are one,
And each minute lost is his eternal regret."
Field of Magic

"Field of Magic:
Holding you so close, in a field of magic love,
your eyes are shining brighter than the starlit sky above.
The flowers that bloom 'round us, they tickle at our feet
the river sleeps behind us, the silence is so sweet.
The wind blows just so slightly, to tell us that it's there,
and to blow the windswept petals, that lovedance in the air.
The passion that is bred here is as old as S'allumer above,
but the only way to feel it, is to bring the one you love."
And even though this magic field is natures' greatest feat,
without you here beside me... the magic's incomplete.

"Field of Magic:
Holding you so close, in a field of magic love,
your eyes are shining brighter than the starlit sky above.
The flowers that bloom 'round us, they tickle at our feet
the river sleeps behind us, the silence is so sweet.
The wind blows just so slightly, to tell us that it's there,
and to blow the windswept petals, that lovedance in the air.
The passion that is bred here is as old as S'allumer above,
but the only way to feel it, is to bring the one you love."
And even though this magic field is natures' greatest feat,
without you here beside me... the magic's incomplete.
Love

"Love:
What is the glory far above
All else in human life?
Love! Love!
There is no form in which the fire
Of love its traces has impressed not.
Man lives far more in love's desire
Than by life's breath, soon possessed not.
If all that lives nust love or lie,
All shapes on earth, or sea, or sky,
With one consent, to
Heaven cry
That the glory far above
All else in life is--
Love! O, Love!
Thou melancholy thought, which art
So fluttering and so sweet, to thee
When did I give the liberty
Thus to afflict my heart?
What is the cause of this new power
Which doth my fevered being move,
Momently raging more and more?
What subtle pain is kindled now,
Which from my heart doth overflow
Into my senses?
Love! O, Love!"

"Love:
What is the glory far above
All else in human life?
Love! Love!
There is no form in which the fire
Of love its traces has impressed not.
Man lives far more in love's desire
Than by life's breath, soon possessed not.
If all that lives nust love or lie,
All shapes on earth, or sea, or sky,
With one consent, to
Heaven cry
That the glory far above
All else in life is--
Love! O, Love!
Thou melancholy thought, which art
So fluttering and so sweet, to thee
When did I give the liberty
Thus to afflict my heart?
What is the cause of this new power
Which doth my fevered being move,
Momently raging more and more?
What subtle pain is kindled now,
Which from my heart doth overflow
Into my senses?
Love! O, Love!"
This Perfect Time

"This Perfect Time:
A misty sunrise fills the east
With yellow, gold and red.
The bowl of space a palest blue,
Sheds light upon our bed.
The warmth beside my soul, a feast
Of love for only you.
So let the birds, with song, remain
Within the morning hours,
To pour upon the crisp, new day
A hope, like cleansing showers.
For you I send refreshing rain
To wash the past away.
A quiet breeze so warm and slow,
Has drifted ‘cross my face.
It brings the scents from flower climbs,
And vanishes without a trace.
It stirred this battered heart, you know,
To love this perfect time.
Like whispers lost at sea, we soar
Beyond the sky of fire.
Together. Lost together, free
To claim our each desire.
Like leaves we float to earth, once more
To close our eyes and be."

"This Perfect Time:
A misty sunrise fills the east
With yellow, gold and red.
The bowl of space a palest blue,
Sheds light upon our bed.
The warmth beside my soul, a feast
Of love for only you.
So let the birds, with song, remain
Within the morning hours,
To pour upon the crisp, new day
A hope, like cleansing showers.
For you I send refreshing rain
To wash the past away.
A quiet breeze so warm and slow,
Has drifted ‘cross my face.
It brings the scents from flower climbs,
And vanishes without a trace.
It stirred this battered heart, you know,
To love this perfect time.
Like whispers lost at sea, we soar
Beyond the sky of fire.
Together. Lost together, free
To claim our each desire.
Like leaves we float to earth, once more
To close our eyes and be."
Rapture

"Rapture:
You kissed me! My head drooped low on your chest
With a feeling of shelter and infinite rest,
While the holy emotions my tongue dared not speak,
Flashed up as in flame, from my heart to my cheek;
Your arms held me fast; oh! your arms were so bold --
Heart beat against heart in their passionate fold.
Your glances seemed drawing my soul through mine eyes,
As the sun draws the mist from the sea to the skies.
Your lips clung to mine till I prayed in my bliss
They might never unclasp from the rapturous kiss."

"Rapture:
You kissed me! My head drooped low on your chest
With a feeling of shelter and infinite rest,
While the holy emotions my tongue dared not speak,
Flashed up as in flame, from my heart to my cheek;
Your arms held me fast; oh! your arms were so bold --
Heart beat against heart in their passionate fold.
Your glances seemed drawing my soul through mine eyes,
As the sun draws the mist from the sea to the skies.
Your lips clung to mine till I prayed in my bliss
They might never unclasp from the rapturous kiss."
the spine of the tome
The spine of the tome is made from claret leather.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[M] \$delay(2, TRUE, "030f"); EmitTo( \$actor, "The book does not react to you in any way except to look more daunting and self-assured in its knowledge.");
